definition: at most/at best

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: At most can support about half.
At most you are only a foolish elephant fooled by some people, HAWHAW.
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，你顶多是一头被别人忽悠的笨象。

sentences.english: I can't give you more than$35, can you sell it for that?
sentences.chinese: 我顶多能出35美元，这个价钱你肯卖吗？

sentences.english: "What you can do now, at best, is to assign people to a part of West Africa, " Jackson says.
sentences.chinese: 现在能做的顶多是将人们划分为西非的一部分。

sentences.english: At this stage of our evolution, they’re little more than remnants.
sentences.chinese: 我们进化到这一阶段，它们顶多是进化的余留物罢了。

sentences.english: When it comes to how a page looks, at best you're only able to make suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 说到页面的外观，顶多您只能提提建议。

sentences.english: The closest it does is it would let you test.
sentences.chinese: 它顶多能让你检查你的计算。

sentences.english: In the cold weather a second cotton tunic over the first one sufficed.
sentences.chinese: 天冷的话，就在身上的布衣上顶多加上一件棉布外褂。

sentences.english: There were not more than seven women in the post office then.
sentences.chinese: 当时在邮局里顶多有七个女人。

sentences.english: The students can attend no more than 25 classes a week at best.
sentences.chinese: 学生每周顶多能上二十五节课。

sentences.english: You've only got a buck to lose and $1000 bucks to gain.
sentences.chinese: 损失顶多一块美金，收获可能会有一千块美金。

sentences.english: I think he is fifteen at (the) most.
Freezing. Maybe a couple of degrees over. Have you ever been to Wisconsin?
sentences.chinese: 像冰一样，顶多高几度，你有没有去过威斯康辛州？

sentences.english: Your current car is old and only worth about $1, 500.
sentences.chinese: 你现在开的车很旧顶多也就值个千把块钱。

sentences.english: They see each other once a month at most.
sentences.chinese: 姐妹俩顶多隔一个月才见一次面。

sentences.english: At best he was commended for his athletic presence and stalwart demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 人们推荐他的理由顶多是健美的身型和忠实的态度。

definition: at most/at best
up to the maximum/upper limit/at most
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
at the minimum/at the very least
that's all/nothing more
at worst/if worst comes to worst/serious/alarming
good and bad/most unfortunate occurrence/in any case/whatever
most/mostly/most likely
perhaps
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
insignificant/trifling/merely
granted that/even if
even/even if/even though/no matter how
taking everything into account (idiom)/when all is said and done
not count as
